source: Palm Sunday attacks: ISIS says it carried out bombings at churches in Egypt that killed at least 37. The ISIS terror group has claimed responsibility for two separate Palm Sunday bombing attacks at Coptic Christian churches in Egypt that have killed 37 people and injured more than 100.

Egypt's Coptic churches hit by deadly blasts on Palm Sunday. In Alexandria, an explosion outside St Mark's Coptic church killed 13 people. Pope Tawadros II, head of the Coptic Church, had been attending Mass inside and was unhurt, state media reported.

ISIS Claims 2 Deadly Explosions at Egyptian Coptic Churches on Palm Sunday. Two explosions at Coptic churches in Egypt on Palm Sunday left at least 40 people dead and injured dozens of others as a day of worship in the besieged Christian community turned to destruction and carnage.
target: Church Bombings in Egypt. ISIS has claimed responsibility for deadly attacks on two Egyptian churches on Palm Sunday.
